definition: to force/to compel/to approach or go towards/urgent/pressing

sentences.english: Mengsk approached the smaller man and stood before him, an intimidating presence.
sentences.chinese: 蒙克斯以威迫的姿态靠近并站在这位小矮人前面。

sentences.english: The most watched development. of course. is the threat of trcommerciinge protectionism.
sentences.chinese: 当然，最有目共睹的进展是贸易袒护主义的威迫。

sentences.english: I won't be browbeaten into accepting your proposals.
sentences.chinese: 我不会在威迫之下接受你的提议。

sentences.english: Mengsk approached the smaller man and stood before him, an intimidating presence.
sentences.chinese: 蒙克斯以威迫的姿态靠近并站在这位小人类前面。

definition: forced submission/to exploit advantage to force sb to do one's bidding
to overawe/to be scared into submission
to compel sb to obey/to force into submission/to subjugate
flank (the side of one's torso)/to coerce/to threaten
use both carrot and stick/use gentle methods and force/an iron hand in a velvet glove
